metadata.title: CVE-2022-42799 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
The issue was addressed with improved UI handling. This issue is fixed intvOS 16.1, macOS Ventura 13, watchOS 9.1, Safari 16.1, iOS 16.1 and iPadOS16. Visiting a malicious website may lead to user interface spoofing.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42799` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
wpewebkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
